qas.question: The school known as Notre Dame is known by a more lengthy name, what is it?
What type of institution is the Notre Dame?
The French words Notre Dame du Lac translate to what in English?
Who is the patron saint of Notre Dame?
How large is Notre Dame in acres?

context: The <a0_0>University of Notre Dame du<a0_0/> Lac (or simply Notre Dame /ˌnoʊtərˈdeɪm/ NOH-tər-DAYM) is a <a1_0>Catholic research university<a1_0/> located adjacent to South Bend, Indiana, in the United States. In French, Notre Dame du Lac means "<a2_0>Our Lady of the Lake<a2_0/>" and refers to the university's patron saint, <a3_0>the Virgin Mary<a3_0/>. The main campus covers <a4_0>1,250<a4_0/> acres in a suburban setting and it contains a number of recognizable landmarks, such as the Golden Dome, the "Word of Life" mural (commonly known as Touchdown Jesus), and the Basilica.
